abstract: 21st Century Fox is said to have offered $80 billion for Time Warner. | The danger of arbitration clauses. | Yahoo to retain more of its Alibaba stake after I.P.O. | Goldman Sachs and JPMorgan Chase second-quarter earnings exceeded analyst expectations.
snippet: 21st Century Fox is said to have offered $80 billion for Time Warner. | The danger of arbitration clauses. | Yahoo to retain more of its Alibaba stake after I.P.O. | Goldman Sachs and JPMorgan Chase second-quarter earnings exceeded analyst expecta...
lead_paragraph: The media giant 21st Century Fox, the empire run by Rupert Murdoch, made an $80 billion takeover bid in recent weeks for Time Warner but was rebuffed, people briefed on the matter said on Wednesday, Andrew Ross Sorkin and Michael J. de la Merced write in DealBook. The bold approach could put Time Warner in play and might again ignite a reshaping of the media industry, prompting a new spate of mega-mergers among the nation’s largest entertainment companies.

headline.main: Morning Agenda: Murdoch Pursues Time Warner

abstract: Many existing backers seem to have returned to Gávea Investments’ new fund, suggesting there remains an appetite for investing in Latin America’s largest economy.
snippet: Many existing backers seem to have returned to Gávea Investments’ new fund, suggesting there remains an appetite for investing in Latin America’s largest economy.
lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO — The investment firm Gávea Investments, founded by the former Brazilian Central Bank president Arminio Fraga and Luiz Henrique Fraga in 2003, is near final closing on a new private equity fund that could exceed $1 billion, two people familiar with its plans said.

headline.main: Brazilian Private Equity Firm Near Closing on $1 Billion Fund
